data.title: Taylor County Liquor License
data.text:
Part of the Tallahassee District in the State of Florida, Taylor County is the best place to open a liquor selling business. Located near Lafayette County, the city of Perry, which is the county seat for Taylor County, is the closest place for Lafayette residents to buy liquor, as their county is one of the last three dry counties in the State of Florida. Therefore, if you are planning to open your own business in Taylor County, then a liquor selling business is an excellent idea.

Liquor License FL can help you open you business in Taylor County, assisting you from start to finish in getting your license and permits, filing for business tax license or for EIN number, as well as many additional services that will help you get started faster and hassle free.

There are several liquor licenses available in Taylor County and each has a different annual fee. You can get a look at the applicable fees in Taylor County below:

Series Provisions Annual Fee 1APS Beer (Package Sales Only) $28.00 2APS Beer and Wine (Package Sales Only) $84.00 1COP Beer (Package and Consumption) $56.00 2COP Beer and Wine (Package and Consumption) $168.00 3DPS Beer, Wine and Spirits (Package Sales Only) $468.50 8COP Beer, Wine and Spirits (Package and Consumption) $624.00 11C Beer, Wine and Spirits (Consumption Only) $400.00

Temporary Fees

All Transfers $100.00 New 1APS $100.00 New 2APS $100.00 New 1COP $100.00 New 2COP $100.00 New 3DPS $117.00 New 7COP $156.00 New 11C $100.00

Special Licenses

There are two types of special licenses available in Taylor County, SFX licenses for restaurants and Special Hotel Licenses. SFX licenses are issued in compliance with Florida Statute 561.20(2)(a)4, while Special Hotel Licenses are regulated by Florida Statute 561.20(2)(a)1, each presenting its own requirements and requests. However, we can help you comply with all the requisites of the municipality and make sure your business is in the right parameters for getting licensed. Contact one of our agents now and we will guide your through the entire process.

Contact Information for County Departments:

DIVISION OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES AND TOBACCO
